content:
What should we do with this page which is left over from all the editing and currently it is under Manage Routes.
Is it useful? Can it be edited down and added to some page?
It really is kind of an orphan at this point, but it might be helpful in terms of understanding how to handle routes in a general way. Someone needs to dig into this. Should it be Edited down or removed?
Or should we just punt it and move it into Advanced Manual?

https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:route_manager:route_handling
I've reviewed the page, it is good, and merged it with "Use Routes" one more page done. Thanks.

Statuts & Progress shows that Use Routes needs some integration of material. I took a look at this page and the text uses route names like:
"The first route is named â€œRoute Name_ckgedit_QUOTA,"
while the screenshot shows the route name as
"Split_Route_Demo_A".
I think the text should match the screenshots. Does anyone disagree?
No, we don't disagree. That must be someones typo or some error.

I've looked this page over and found that one section that I moved from Route Properties earlier, actually belongs back on that page because it describes the ending line at the bottom. I have moved it back, including how to split a route using the button at the bottom.
I've fixed the route names and a few other minor things, like "wpt" to "waypoint". There are still some FIXMEs where screenshots are desired.
